column3: Hmm.. on one hand, I agree that it doesn't strictly need to be a function, on the other hand, I don't really like exported free-for-all global state as you cannot enforce read-only. It's almost a necessity to have getters/setters in C++ for this reason.\n\nI don't buy "CPU efficient" here. DataDir is used sparsely with I/O, not with intensive computation. Wouldn't it be nicer to simply make the GetDataDir() function use a static constant but non global variable? I don't really like the solution this pull offers.\n
